title: 'Go out and do it again': Wolves return to WCF
content: The Timberwolves are back in the Western Conference finals for the second straight year after closing out the Warriors with a 121-110 win in Game 5 on Wednesday night.

title: Warriors had title shot if Curry healthy, Kerr says
content: The Warriors credited the Wolves and avoided excuses but acknowledged the impact of injuries to Stephen Curry and Jimmy Butler as their season ended.

title: Eagles-Chiefs rematch in W2 as NFL sked unveiled
content: A rematch of Super Bowl LIX between the Philadelphia Eagles and Kansas City Chiefs will take place in Week 2 of the NFL season.

title: Johnson's Bears debut vs. Vikes opens MNF slate
content: The 2025 "Monday Night Football" schedule kicks off with an NFC North showdown between the Vikings and Bears on Sept. 8, when Ben Johnson makes his head coaching debut for Chicago.

title: Refocused Celtics lean on D, Kornet to stay alive
content: The Celtics used a reinvigorated defense and the unlikely breakout of backup big man Luke Kornet to keep their season alive and send this playoff series against the Knicks back to New York for Game 6 on Friday.

title: Kapanen's OT winner propels Oilers to West finals
content: Kasperi Kapanen scored on a scramble in front of the net at 7:14 of overtime, and the Edmonton Oilers beat the Vegas Golden Knights 1-0 in Game 5 on Wednesday night to advance to the Western Conference finals for the second year in a row.

title: Reds celebrate Rose day after MLB reinstatement
content: Pete Rose was honored by the Reds on Wednesday night, a day after he was posthumously removed from MLB's permanent ineligibility list.

title: Madrid's Asencio may be charged for explicit video
content: Real Madrid defender Raúl Asencio and three former teammates from the club's youth teams could face criminal charges for allegedly recording sexual images of a woman and a minor and distributing them without their consent.

title: Aina: Offside flag could have averted Awoniyi injury
content: Forest's Aina has said the injury that saw Awoniyi placed in an induced coma could have been avoided if the the offside flag had gone up in time.

title: Sources: Maresca set for Chelsea stay, UCL or not
content: Enzo Maresca is set to remain as Chelsea manager regardless of whether they qualify for next season's Champions League, sources have told ESPN.

title: Mascherano: Miami must learn how to suffer
content: Javier Mascherano said his team needs to learn how to "suffer some moments" if it is to make progress and get better results than Wednesday's 3-3 draw.

content: On April 29, 2025, the Bombay High Court received a draft of the GR from the State government saying that it would be dealing with safe house for inter faith and inter caste couples, both married and unmarried.

title: Nagmohan Das Commission considering changing names of certain Scheduled Caste communities that are used as cuss words in Karnataka
content: He pointed out that of the 186 scheduled castes and sub-castes, many of the names were given by the upper castes

title: Rumblings in Congress over KPCC rejig get louder with former president K. Sudhakaran expressing public displeasure

content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee and Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari expressed condolences over the demise of the sitting MLA

content: Sudhakaran says ‘even if Election Commission is to initiate a case over the matter, it will not be a problem’

title: Five, including two children killed as bus catches fire in Lucknow
content: According to police, the private sleeper bus which was its way from Begusarai in Bihar to Delhi, caught fire due to a suspected short circuit.

content: ‘When it (the encounter with Manipur militants) gets over, we will be able to share details,’ says Defence official

title: Supreme Court hearing updates: CJI Gavai-led Bench lists waqf case for further hearing on May 20
content: The top court will consider question of interim relief in pleas and also noted it will not consider any plea seeking stay of provisions of earlier 1995 Waqf law

title: Bengaluru HAL Airport reopening: Stakeholders meet, deliberate on modalities
content: Today, it takes almost two hours to even reach the gates of the Kempegowda International Airport (KIA), more than 40 km away from the city centre. The chaotic Hebbal interchange is in a mess, severely slowing down the airport approach by road

title: "To My Mind...": Shashi Tharoor On Congress'  'Lakshman Rekha'  Remark
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Thursday clarified that his comments on the India-Pakistan conflict were made in a personal capacity, as an "Indian and a proud citizen", and did not reflect the official stand of the party.

title: JNU, Jamia, University In Hyderabad Lead 'Cancel Turkey' Move Over Pak Support
content: Several prominent universities in India have cancelled tie-ups and programmes with Turkey's educational institutions over the West Asian nation's military support to Pakistan.

title: After Pak 'Pleads' On Indus Treaty, S Jaishankar's "To Stay Paused" Remark
content: Foreign minister S Jaishankar, speaking of Operation Sindoor and cessation of hostilities with Pakistan, said today that it was clear that who had called for a ceasefire.

title: Explained: Disinformation Campaign On Macron's "Cocaine Use" In Ukraine
content: Unsubstantiated claims of supposed cocaine use by French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Friedrich Merz on a train to Ukraine last weekend may have started from a French account.

title: CRPF Dog Stung 200 Times By Swarm Of Bees During Anti-Maoist Operation, Dies
content: Rolo, a two-year-old female sniffer dog of the CRPF, was the only casualty suffered by the security forces during their biggest anti-Maoist operation at the Korgotalu hills.

title: After JNU, Jamia Millia Islamia Suspends Agreements With Turkey
content: Jamia Millia Islamia has suspended all Memorandum of Understanding (MoUs) with Turkish educational institutions, amid escalating calls across the country to boycott Turkey over its vocal support for Pakistan during the recent conflict.

title: On Camera, Naked Man Breaks Into Bengaluru Shop, Steals Phones Worth Rs 25 Lakh
content: With a mask on his face and a torchlight in hand, a thief entered a mobile shop in Bengaluru with one crucial thing missing - his clothes.

title: Singer Sonu Nigam Gets Karnataka High Court Relief In Pahalgam Remark Row
content: In some relief for singer Sonu Nigam amid the row surrounding his 'Kannada' remark, the Karnataka High Court has said that the state government has assured no coercive action will be taken against the artiste provided he cooperates with the probe

title: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE: Pakistan Has A Lot Of Terrorists, Says S Jaishankar
content: India Pakistan Ceasefire LIVE Updates: Pakistan's nuclear weapons should be brought under the supervision of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) as they are not safe in such a rogue nation, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said on Thursday.

title: 5 Of Family Killed, 8 Injured After "Fast-Moving" Truck Rams Car In UP
content: Five members of a family were killed and eight others seriously injured in a collision between a car and a speeding truck on the Balrampur-Bahraich National Highway, officials said Thursday.

title: Video: Indian Army's Tanks, Mechanised Infantry Roll Out At Firing Range
content: The Indian Army's Trishakti Corps conducted an exercise at a field range to validate joint operations and combat in all kinds of terrain, among other capabilities.

title: On Camera, Karnataka Man Stabs Teacher After Dispute Over Cricket Ball
content: An argument over whether a young man's cricket ball landed at his teacher's house took a violent turn when the former assaulted and stabbed the latter in Karnataka's Bagalkot district.

title: Inside The Turkish Firm That Handles High-Security Tasks At Indian Airports
content: Turkey's decision to back Pakistan during the recent India-Pakistan stand-off has led to massive outrage against the West Asian nation.

title: Pakistan "Pleads" With India To Reconsider Indus Waters Treaty Suspension
content: Pakistan has reportedly written a letter to India, urging it to reconsider the decision to put the Indus Waters Treaty into abeyance.

title: "When Tharoor Saab Speaks...": Congress Sends A "Lakshman Rekha" Message
content: Flowers from foes, fire from friends -- this sums up what Congress leader Shashi Tharoor is going through these days. While the Thiruvananthapuram MP has drawn cheers from his critics for articulating India's position amid its tensions with Pakistan

title: No Radiation Leak From Any Nuclear Facility In Pakistan: Nuclear Watchdog IAEA
content: Global nuclear watchdog IAEA has said there was no radiation leak or release from any nuclear facility in Pakistan during the country's recent military conflict with India.

title: "Go And Apologise": Top Court To Minister Over Colonel Sofiya Qureshi Remark
content: The Supreme Court today sharply rebuked Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah over his controversial remarks directed at Indian Army officer Colonel Sofiya Qureshi.

title: "Are Nukes Safe With Pak?" Rajnath Singh Calls For International Supervision
content: Earlier this week, Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Punjab's Adampur air base and interacted with soldiers.

title: Trump Says US, Iran Close To Nuclear Deal: "They Sort Of Agreed To Terms"
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday said the United States was getting very close to securing a nuclear deal with Iran, as he warned Tehran that it was its only option to avoid military actions.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump Is So, So Wrong In Lumping India And Pakistan Together
content: No doubt the Pahalgam assault was condemned by the US and others, but it means little from India's point of view if they did not take cognisance of Pakistan's role in it.

title: Op Sindoor: India cancels security clearance of Turkish firm amid rising tensions
content: The Indian government revoked security clearance for Celebi Airport Services India, impacting ground handling operations at nine major airports due to national security concerns. This decision follows Turkey's perceived support for Pakistan, particularly after recent events. Celebi, partly owned by Turkish President Erdogan's family, faces replacement by other ground handlers at airports like Delhi and Mumbai.

title: 'I helped': Trump changes tune on India-Pakistan ceasefire
content: Donald Trump again claimed to have mediated a ceasefire between India and Pakistan following India's Operation Sindoor, sparked by a terror attack. Trump stated he encouraged trade talks to de-escalate the conflict, but India has denied any US mediation, reaffirming that discussions with Pakistan will only address terrorism and the return of Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, emphasizing a strictly bilateral approach.

title: Trump warns Apple about ‘Make in India’, will Tim Cook listen?
content: Despite Donald Trump's request for Apple to increase manufacturing in the United States, Apple has reaffirmed its commitment to expanding its manufacturing presence in India. Apple executives have assured Indian government officials that their investment plans remain unchanged, with India continuing to be a crucial manufacturing destination.

title: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warns: ‘India is at the epicentre of the global…’
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath expressed concern over rising soft drink consumption in India, linking it to the country's diabetes epidemic. He highlighted alarming statistics, including the high risk for young adults and lack of awareness. Kamath emphasized the need for public awareness, insurance coverage, early detection programs, and lifestyle changes to combat this growing health crisis.

title: What EAM Jaishankar said on Trump's offer to mediate Kashmir talks
content: S. Jaishankar firmly stated that talks with Pakistan are contingent on addressing terrorism, emphasizing the need for them to dismantle terror infrastructure and act on the provided list of terrorists. He also mentioned that the Indus Waters Treaty will remain suspended until cross-border terrorism ceases.

title: 'Leadership is about character': R Ashwin on selecting next Test captain
content: Indian cricket faces a transition as Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's Test retirements mark a new era. Selectors are tasked with rebuilding the team, potentially starting with Shubman Gill in the upcoming England series. Ravichandran Ashwin emphasizes the importance of character in leadership, suggesting a thorough evaluation process for selecting the next captain, similar to the Australian method.

title: Why Trump's message to Apple CEO maybe bad news for India
content: Donald Trump has expressed his disapproval to Tim Cook regarding Apple's increasing manufacturing presence in India, amidst the company's efforts to diversify away from China due to tariffs and diplomatic tensions. Trump wants Apple to increase manufacturing operations in the United States.

title: Microsoft's second biggest job cuts: Coders, managers, & others asked to leave
content: Microsoft's recent layoffs disproportionately affected software engineers, with over 40% of Washington state cuts hitting coding professionals. Project management roles also saw significant impact as the company invests heavily in AI, which is automating aspects of software development.

title: Who should captain India Test team? R Ashwin picks his first choice
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has endorsed Jasprit Bumrah as his top choice to succeed Rohit Sharma as India's Test captain, citing Bumrah's leadership qualities on his YouTube channel. Despite concerns over workload management, Ashwin expressed disappointment if Bumrah isn't considered.

title: AB de Villiers reveals his initial dislike for Virat Kohli
content: AB de Villiers revealed his initial dislike for Virat Kohli stemmed from their fierce competitiveness on the field. This transformed into a deep friendship when they became teammates at RCB in the IPL. Their partnership became legendary, marked by record-breaking runs and a mutual understanding that transcended the game, forging a bond of brotherhood.

title: Melinda Gates on when she realised its time to end marriage with Bill Gates
content: Melinda French Gates revealed a recurring dream of standing on a crumbling cliff with Bill Gates and their children influenced her decision to divorce. This dream, along with surfacing information like Bill's association with Jeffrey Epstein, served as a catalyst. She also experienced panic attacks during the separation, highlighting the emotional toll of ending their 27-year marriage.

title: Cong questions 'total chuppi' from PM Modi on Trump's 'zero-tariff' claim
content: The Congress party is demanding answers from Prime Minister Modi regarding President Trump's claim that India has offered a "zero-tariff deal" to the United States. Jairam Ramesh questioned the Prime Minister's silence and the connection to the "Operation Sindoor" stoppage. Manish Tewari insists on an explicit response from the government.

title: Former Australian cricketer says IPL and PSL should 'end now'
content: IPL 2025 will restart on Saturday. Royal Challengers Bengaluru will face Kolkata Knight Riders. The tournament was paused due to India-Pakistan tensions. The restart follows a ceasefire. BCCI is urging foreign players to return. Safety concerns remain after the hostilities. The final match is now scheduled for June 3. Uncertainty surrounds foreign players' return for the second leg.

title: Sensex 1,200 points up: Top 5 reasons for bulls' party
content: Stock market today: Indian stock markets surged, with Nifty50 surpassing 25,000 and Sensex closing above 82,000, fueled by optimism surrounding potential US-India trade deals and declining oil and gold prices.

title: Op Sindoor: India demonstrated tech edge by beating Pak’s Chinese systems
content: India successfully conducted strikes against terror hubs, bypassing Pakistan's air defenses. The Indian Air Force also thwarted multiple retaliatory missile and drone attacks. Indigenous air defence network played a crucial role during the hostilities. The armed forces are on high alert, maintaining operational readiness. India is adhering to the bilateral understanding to cease military action.

title: Trump says India has offered a trade deal with ‘literally no tariffs’
content: Donald Trump has claimed India's proposal for a trade agreement with "no tariffs". This move comes as India seeks a trade deal with the U.S. amidst Trump's 90-day suspension of tariff increases, which previously included a 26% duty on Indian goods.

title: 'If you can train someone, why not Jadeja': Ashwin on India's Test captain
content: With Virat Kohli's retirement, Team India faces crucial decisions regarding Test leadership and the number four batting position. While Shubman Gill is a potential candidate for both roles, Ravichandran Ashwin suggests considering Ravindra Jadeja for captaincy. Ashwin highlights Jadeja's experience and leadership potential, drawing from his CSK captaincy stint.

title: The controversy surrounding Rohit Bal’s will: A legacy shrouded in mystery
content: Following Rohit Bal's untimely death, a controversy erupted over a purported will presented by Lalit Tehlan. Doubts arose regarding the will's authenticity, with handwriting analysis suggesting forgery and key figures, like Sunil Sethi, denying any knowledge of it.

title: 'Rok sako to rok lo': Rahul's message to PM Modi, Nitish Kumar in Bihar
content: Rahul Gandhi faced police obstruction en route to Ambedkar hostel in Darbhanga, where he planned to engage with students at a 'Shiksha Nyay Samvad' event. Despite the attempts to stop him, Gandhi entered the premises and criticized the Bihar government as a "Double Engine Dhokebaaz Sarkaar," vowing to implement social justice measures if his party comes to power.

title: Rohit vs Virat: Former South Africa cricketer makes a huge statement
content: Herschelle Gibbs ignited a social media debate by asserting that Rohit Sharma possesses a superior technique compared to Virat Kohli. Gibbs emphasized Rohit's technical correctness, particularly his defensive prowess, while acknowledging Kohli's dominance and aggressive approach, especially in white-ball cricket. This comparison sparked considerable discussion among fans, contrasting the two Indian batting stalwarts.

title: Tom Brady spurs early roster shake-up at Las Vegas Raiders: Three players released
content: Tom Brady's increasing presence within the Las Vegas Raiders is already triggering substantial changes. The team released Amari Burney, Matthew Butler, and Justin Marshall, signaling an early roster overhaul. Insiders suggest Brady's voice is pushing for higher standards, aiming to cultivate a stronger competitive environment and rebuild a winning culture within the team.

title: From Nushrratt Bharuccha to Ileana D'Cruz: Why heroines get replaced in sequels
content: Bollywood sequels often replace actresses. Male leads usually stay. Female actors are recast for new stories or market trends. Nushrratt Bharuccha was replaced in Dream Girl 2. Ileana D'Cruz was replaced in Raid 2. Actresses like Shreya Gupto discuss the business side. This practice shows gender bias. It also highlights the importance of box-office success in Indian cinema.

title: Neeraj Chopra speaks on relationship with Arshad Nadeem
content: Neeraj Chopra addressed his relationship with Arshad Nadeem. He mentioned the impact of India-Pakistan relations on their interactions. Chopra is set to compete in the Doha Diamond League. He will face strong competition from Anderson Peters and Jakub Vadlejch. Kishore Jena, another Indian athlete, will also participate. Chopra aims to reclaim the Doha DL title, having won it in 2023.

title: The real reason India’s getting tough on Donald Trump’s trade terms
content: India is escalating its trade disputes with the US, challenging tariffs at the WTO and signaling a shift from defense to offense. Inspired by China's tactics and triggered by Trump's claims of brokering a ceasefire with Pakistan, India asserts its strategic autonomy. New Delhi prioritizes signaling strength and diversifying trade relationships amid ongoing tensions with Washington.

title: 18 Haryana schools record 0% pass rate in Class 12 boards examination
content: The Haryana Board of School Education (HBSE) has flagged 100 underperforming schools, including 18 with a zero percent pass rate in the Class 12 board exams, to the Directorate of Education. The HBSE chairman, Dr. Pawan Kumar, emphasized the need for teacher training and engagement with students and parents to address the causes of the poor results and improve performance.

title: R Ashwin breaks silence on India’s Test captaincy debate
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has ignited debate over India's next Test captain, suggesting Jasprit Bumrah, a 'national treasure,' deserves consideration despite workload concerns. He also proposes Ravindra Jadeja as a short-term option, emphasizing the importance of consistent selection and mentoring a younger player like Shubman Gill. Ashwin advocates for a formal interview process to assess leadership qualities beyond on-field performance.

title: TMC MLA Tapas Saha dies of brain haemorrhage at Kolkata hospital
content: Trinamool Congress MLA Tapas Saha, representing Tehatta constituency in Nadia district, passed away at a Kolkata hospital due to a brain haemorrhage at the age of 66. Saha was admitted to the hospital after collapsing on Tuesday, but his condition deteriorated.

title: Why Kanye West's pro-Hitler song is illegal in Germany
content: Controversy surrounds Ye's new single. The song contains antisemitic content. It is banned on many platforms. However, it remains available on Elon Musk's X. This raises questions about content moderation policies. Other platforms like Spotify and YouTube removed the song. The debate highlights the challenges tech companies face. They struggle to remove the offensive content effectively.

title: Watch: Army conducts successful 'Teesta Prahar' exercise
content: The Indian Army conducted 'Teesta Prahar,' a field training exercise showcasing operational capabilities and coordination in river-based terrain, incorporating advanced weaponry and technology. Simultaneously, the Defence Research & Development Organisation (DRDO) has developed a domestic nanoporous membrane for high-pressure seawater desalination, successfully tested on Indian Coast Guard vessels. This innovation addresses stability concerns and supports the 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' initiative.

title: Watch: Paris locals fight armed men kidnapping CEO’s pregnant daughter and her child
content: In Paris, the pregnant daughter of a crypto executive and her child were targeted in a kidnapping attempt. Masked assailants attacked, but locals intervened, thwarting the abduction. The victims sustained minor injuries, and the attackers fled in a fake delivery van.

title: 'Sinister intent': CM Stalin on President's letter to SC on guv verdict
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin has strongly criticized the Centre's Presidential reference regarding governors' powers, deeming it an attempt to undermine the Constitution and paralyze non-BJP state legislatures. He argues it subverts the Supreme Court's settled position on governors' roles and accuses the BJP of using governors to weaken democratically elected state governments.

title: Pope welcomes Sinner to Vatican
content: Pope Leo XIV, the new pontiff, is gaining attention as a sports enthusiast. He showed his love for baseball and tennis. Jannik Sinner, the world's top-ranked tennis player, visited the Pope Leo XIV. Sinner gifted him a racket and invited him to play. The Pope joked about Wimbledon's dress code. Sinner is preparing for his Italian Open quarterfinal match.

title: 'My way': How Virat Kohli's farewell story on Instagram becomes a testament to his career
content: Virat Kohli, India's beloved cricketer, retires from Test cricket, marking the end of an era defined by his 'My Way' approach. His fitness obsession, bold captaincy decisions like prioritizing pace bowling, and early adoption of social media shaped his career. Kohli leaves behind a legacy of records, brand endorsements, and iconic status, inspiring future generations with his leadership and determination.

title: 'Pak jahan khada hota hai ...': Rajnath tweaks Bachchan's dialogue to slam Islamabad
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, during his visit to Srinagar, took a jibe at Pakistan's economic woes, contrasting it with India's growing financial stature. He lauded the Army personnel for Operation Sindoor, emphasizing its necessity in combating Pakistan-sponsored terrorism. Singh also acknowledged the public's anger against terrorism following the Pahalgam attack, praising the forces for their actions across the border.

title: Gambhir, first batch of India Test squad likely to leave for England on June 6
content: Gautam Gambhir and the initial group of Test players are scheduled to depart for England on June 6, with subsequent departures contingent on IPL 2025 commitments. Gambhir will concentrate on preparing the Test squad, while support staff may join the team directly in England. The India A squad's departure will also be staggered, commencing on May 25.

title: How much prize money did Team India earn in World Test Championship 2023-25?
content: Despite missing the World Test Championship final, India secured a substantial USD 1.44 million for finishing third in the 2023-25 cycle. The ICC announced a record USD 5.76 million prize pool, with Australia and South Africa set to compete for the top prize at Lord's. India, led by Rohit Sharma, won nine out of 19 matches in the cycle.

title: At $329 billion, Tamil Nadu about to overtake Pakistan's GDP
content: Over the past two decades, Pakistan's economic lead over Indian states like Tamil Nadu and Maharashtra has diminished significantly. In 2004-05, Pakistan's GDP was $132 billion, while Tamil Nadu's GSDP was only $48 billion. By 2023-24, Tamil Nadu's GSDP has nearly equaled Pakistan's GDP, reaching $329 billion, highlighting a growing economic divergence.

title: Watch: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma leave for Bengaluru ahead of IPL restart
content: Following his surprising Test retirement, Virat Kohli is gearing up for the resumption of IPL 2025, spotted with wife Anushka Sharma en route to Bengaluru. Kohli, having recently visited Vrindavan, now shifts his focus to leading Royal Challengers Bengaluru's batting line-up as they prepare to host Kolkata Knight Riders on Saturday.

title: Genelia Deshmukh says working with Aamir Khan in ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ feels ‘special’
content: Genelia Deshmukh is making a comeback with Aamir Khan in 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. She describes the role as special. Aamir plays a basketball coach training intellectually disabled children. The film explores themes of growth and acceptance. It features ten new young actors. Aamir Khan returns to acting after a break. The movie is set to release on June 20.

title: 'Exercise restraint': SC slams minister for 'irresponsible' remarks on Col. Sofiya Qureshi
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah for his "irresponsible" remarks about Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, emphasizing that individuals in constitutional roles must exercise caution, especially during sensitive operations like Operation Sindoor. Shah's comments, suggesting the Prime Minister sent a "terrorists' sister" to harm them, led to widespread condemnation and a High Court order for an FIR against him.

title: The lesson of Pete Rose and 'Shoeless' Joe? History is messy
content: if long overdue, reversal of policy, first reported by ESPN's Don Van Natta Jr. . manfred lifted bans on all deceased players, including Pete Rose and "Shoeless" Joe Jackson . most died decades ago and were on the list for gambling-related offenses .

title: 'You need a reality show for that room:' How the Giants' quarterback room developed
content: gm Joe Schoen and coach Brian daboll sat down for a meeting with owner John Mara . they had to explain what went wrong and how they were going to move forward . outlined all the potential quarterback options: from the top of the draft with Cam Ward .

title: Arsenal's new 2025-26 home kit will get fans' hearts racing
content: arsenal have unveiled their new home kit for the 2025-26 premier league season . the new kit is based on the beat of the human heart, the vital organ that keeps blood pumping through each and every one of us . there is a return for the chunky crew neck collar last seen in 2020-21 .

title: Back for more: What will Clark, Reese and 2024 rookie class do for an encore?
content: WNBA rookies caitlin Clark and Angel Reese set rookie records for points (Clark), rebounds and assists . the 2024 draft produced four other players who averaged at least seven points per game last season . a full offseason behind them, plus additional veteran help for several of last year's top rookies .

title: The NBA's balance of power shifted on Monday night
content: defending champions Boston Celtics lose Jayson Tatum for the rest of the season . when leBron James chose the Miami Heat on July 8, 2010, when Kevin Durant joined the Golden State Warriors on July 7, 2016. When Kobe Bryant dropped 60 points in the final game of his career on April 13, 2016 .

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Can the Capitals and Jets force Game 6s?
content: the second round of the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs has reached the point where elimination games will be played every night . first up are the Washington Capitals, down 3-1 and hosting the Carolina Hurricanes ( 7 p.m. ET, TNT . the canes have the third shortest odds to win the Cup (+325) while the Caps are +1300 .

title: The 100 most impactful transfers for the 2025 college football season
content: more than 3,400 FBS scholarship players entered the NCAA transfer portal this offseason . the first window lasted from Dec. 9 to Dec. 28 and the second went from April 16 to April 25 . which players ended up being the most coveted on the open market?

title: Ranking MLB's Rivalry Weekend matchups: Which feuds burn hottest?
content: a rivalry weekend begins on friday night . it's one of those old, intrastate civic rivalries that bubbled in the minors for decades . the rivalry has grew slowly at the big league level once interleague play be .

title: NBA playoff takeaways: Celtics hold off Knicks, force Game 6
content: no. 2 seed Boston Celtics held off the no. 3 seed New York Knicks in Game 5 on Wednesday night . Oklahoma City Thunder took a 3-1 series lead against the No. 4 seed Denver Nuggets .

title: Warriors offseason guide: How to build around Steph, Draymond and Jimmy
content: Minnesota Timberwolves beat the los Angeles Lakers 103-96 to secure a 4-1 series win . the lottery-bound franchises will secure the no. 1 pick and the chance to draft Cooper Flagg . we're breaking down the potential moves for each franchise, including the state of the roster .

title: Graziano makes sense of 10 lingering offseason questions
content: the offseason is not over yet . there are still a few big-name free agents kicking around . the draft is where most of the big moves happen . here, we try to answer your questions about what your team didn't do this offseason .

title: Potential upsets? Hitters to watch? Early favorites? We preview the 2025 softball regionals
content: the Oklahoma Sooners begin their quest for a fifth straight ring as the regionals begin on friday . eight of the overall top 10 seeds are from the conference . some of the best pitchers are playing for teams like Texas Tech (NiJaree Canady), Arizona State (Kenzie Brown).
